name: Benepass
headline: Fintech for corporate compensation
description:
Benepass consolidates corporate benefits onto a single card, powered by our in-house fintech payments stack

We help companies take care of their employees through tax-advantaged benefits (e.g. FSA/HSA, dependent care, commuter) and company-funded stipends (e.g. wellness, WFH, professional development) all on a single card + mobile app.

With Benepass, HR teams can centralize all ancillary benefits and perks in the same place and make them a no-brainer for employees to use and engage with.

founders.name: Jaclyn Chen, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder / CEO at Benepass. Former investment banking / private equity investor focused on financial services. Stanford GSB grad.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Benepass**

Founded in 2019 and based in New York, **Benepass** is a fintech company that specializes in simplifying corporate compensation through a unique benefits platform. Initially birthed during Y Combinator’s Winter 2020 batch, the company has quickly established itself as an innovator in the HR tech landscape.

### Mission
Benepass aims to consolidate corporate benefits onto a single card, streamlining the management of employee perks. Their mission is to enable companies to provide robust, tax-advantaged benefits while simplifying the experience for HR teams and employees alike.

### What They Do
Benepass integrates various employee benefits—like Health Savings Accounts (HSAs), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), commuter benefits, and wellness stipends—into one comprehensive solution. This allows HR departments to manage all ancillary benefits in one place, making it easier for employees to engage with and utilize their benefits.

Their flexible cards empower employees to customize their perks based on individual needs. An added bonus is the mobile app that plays a central role in managing these benefits, making them accessible anytime, anywhere.

### Current Offerings
To stay ahead in the competitive landscape, Benepass is actively promoting its **2024 Benefits Benchmarking Guide**, which provides insights into leading pre-tax programs and competitive stipend contributions. They also offer a plethora of features like Lifestyle Spending Accounts (Lifes), professional development funds, and wellness benefits, all designed to adapt to the evolving needs of today’s workforce.

### Team and Growth
Benepass operates with a dedicated team of 45 employees and is guided by notable investors, including Gustaf Alstromer. The platform has attracted over 100,000 employees from top companies, indicating strong market adoption and trust.

### Benefits to Companies
The primary advantage of using Benepass is its transformative potential for employee engagement. By combining various benefits into one user-friendly platform, companies report engagement rates soaring above 85%, dramatically higher than the traditional models which often struggle to engage employees.

### Conclusion
In essence, Benepass isn’t just about benefits; it's about empowering employees to make choices that fit their lifestyle. As companies increasingly recognize the importance of personalized employee experiences, Benepass positions itself at the forefront of this evolution—transforming the often tedious world of corporate benefits into a seamless, engaging experience. 

For more information and to explore how Benepass can redefine your benefits structure, visit [getbenepass.com](http://www.getbenepass.com).
